Description: Body fragment of East Greek black-figured, probably closed, pottery vessel; heavy wheel marks on the interior. On slipped exterior, a feline to right; its foreleg and part of its neck and head remain; incision for both interior details and outline; unincised circular rosettes in the field; added red on the neck; below, band with superimposed red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 10, no. 26 pl. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.892)
